snippet: As California and other areas of the country grapple with drought, the reuse of water is less a technological challenge than a marketing problem.
abstract: California is scrambling for ways to cope with drought, and Orange County is taking on challenge of convincing public recycled water can be safe to drink; special purification plant, in operation since 2008, sends purified water from a wastewater treatment plant into underground aquifers for dilution into natural water supply, rather than directly into drinking water treatment plants; process seems to be helping officials bypass 'yuck factor' from consumers.
lead_paragraph: As California and other areas of the country grapple with drought, the reuse of water is less a technological challenge than a marketing problem.

headline.main: Water Flowing From Toilet to Tap May Be Hard to Swallow
headline.print_headline: Toilet to Tap, Hard to Swallow
